intro: Ziziphus bidens, commonly known as the two-lobed date tree, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Rhamnaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves with two to four pairs of leaflets. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that give way to edible, date-like fruits. Ziziphus bidens is adapted to arid and semi-arid climates, making it a resilient species in dry environments. Its botanical features make it an important plant in traditional medicine and local ecosystems.
